intro: Leonurus cardiaca, commonly known as heartworts, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its small, pink or purple flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from June to August. The plant has hairy, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, wastelands, and along roadsides. Leonurus cardiaca is also known for its medicinal properties, historically used in traditional herbal remedies.
